revised_title: Observations of a Luminous Arch in the Sky
tldr: In a letter to the Royal Society, J. Franklin and Sir Joseph Banks reported an unusual celestial event observed on a Monday evening in 1786. A white light, broader than a rainbow, passed across the sky from east to west, with its southern side above Castor and passing through the Hyades. The phenomenon lasted for a few minutes before gradually fading away.
